intro: Quiina duckei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and clustered foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental horticulture. Quiina duckei prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
